attributes.action: Free prescription charges in England
attributes.background:
Why should people in England be charged for prescriptions?
Why can the rest of the "United Kingdom" be exempt the same as Wales Scotland, Northern Ireland.
This is direct discrimination against anyone living in England.

attributes.action: Let the general public have a vote on military action in Syria.
attributes.background: Let the public vote on military action in syria. Let us have a say on how our military should be used, not just government.
attributes.additional_details: With tensions rising in Syria it's important to protect our military from going into another war in the middle east.

attributes.action: Outlaw the use of gas gun type bird scarers.  They dont work and are a nuisance
attributes.background:
Gas gun type bird scarers are used by farmers to scare birds from their crops.
They periodically make a series of loud bangs to scare the birds.
The loud bang also scares passers by, horse and dogs.
The birds return after a few minutes making them ineffective and a nuisance.
attributes.additional_details:
There do not appear to be any statutory restrictions on the the use of gas guns but the NFU has guidelines on their use:- https://www.nfuonline.com/assets/4662

The guidelines are largely ignored, the gas guns are inevitably plonked in a field and forgotten about.
Their proliferation has made the countryside sound like a battlefield.

Given how ineffective they are and the number of them that are thoughtlessly deployed (too many for local authority control). They should be outlawed.

attributes.action: Subsidy on "free from" products for people with food allergies
attributes.background: After having a child who is food intolerant to several things including dairy, wheat and fish & meeting several people in similar positions who all struggle to get anything on prescription, I want to petition for the Government to provide a subsidy for these expensive but necessary items.

attributes.action: Create regulatory body to set the standards and ethics of AI development.
attributes.background: Working under the acronym OF-AIR - Office of AI Regulation, this organisation would utilise respected minds across areas such as Ethical Philosophy, Law and Technology to regulate the means and use of AI across technological sectors to prevent industrial monopoly or unethical development.
attributes.additional_details: From self driving cars or platooning vehicles, to corrupt algorithms manipulating politics and ultimately the ability to create robots that can 'think for themselves', what was once the realms of Science Fiction is now upon us as a reality and should be controlled to prevent corruption across both industry and individuals and to mitigate political and unlawful gain.

attributes.action: Start supplementing milk with Vitamin D.
attributes.background: Many countries supplement their milk supply with vitamin d and the UK which rarely gets sunshine does not.
attributes.additional_details: There has been evidence showing that many in the UK suffer from vitamin d deficiencies.

attributes.action: Allow Ambulances on non-emergency journeys to use Bus Lanes.
attributes.background: Make a nationwide policy to allow NHS Ambulances on non-emergency journeys to use Bus Lanes at all times. This would recognise that Ambulance journeys are important.  Ambulances sitting in queues of traffic while Bus Lanes are free doesn't make much sense. This would save the NHS money.
attributes.additional_details: NHS ambulances are a form of public transport & should have the same right to use Bus Lanes as Buses & Taxis.

attributes.action: Give anyone who has a long-term health condition medication on the NHS
attributes.background:
Some people end up needing hospital treatment because they cannot afford their medication. 

Health officials say they have made sure people with chronic illnesses have access to affordable prescription but the current system is arbitrary and unfair.
attributes.additional_details: People with Diabetes have their medication and equipments on the NHS but what about people who have the leading cause of death being Heart Disease in the UK/World-wide? Conditions such as Heart Disease, Crohns or Parkinson's etc should be available on the NHS, doing this could save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Make the using mobile phone whilst driving punishment the same as drink driving.
attributes.background: I see at least 10 people a day using their phone whilst driving they are not concentrating on the road or they're holding the traffic up because they are too busy looking at their phone. The ban should be the same as drink driving because they are not looking at the road.

attributes.action: Make all companies provide an e mail address as a point of contact
attributes.background: Received a letter from Sky and tried to ring this morning  -  automated service had no option to cancel for my reason! - cut off, tried chat, more than half an hour no one came on to chat - at least an hour of my time wasted! I have a life!
attributes.additional_details: This issue does not just apply to Sky it applies to many big companies, people do not have the time to hang on phone lines for lengthy times due to insufficient staff, or to wait to speak to customer service on line.  Often the problem could be put in an e mail and sent, then the customer just waits for a reply instead of getting frustrated and angry waiting on phone lines.

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all non-recyclable plastics in the UK by 2025
attributes.background:
Plastic is a direct threat to the long term survival of all species, with the amount of plastic pollution in the oceans and land expanding at a catastrophic rate.
HM Government's strategy on plastic waste is inadequate in its current form and must be reviewed to ban all harmful plastics by 2025.

attributes.action: Invite Vladimir Putin to the UK to discuss UK-Russia relations
attributes.background:
Britain's most famous Prime Minister Winston Churchill said "Jaw Jaw is better than War War". 
If he refuses to come it will speak volumes. If he does come maybe we can avert a tit-for-tat escalation.

attributes.action: Make a guarantee for no physical checks at NI side of border nor between GB & NI
attributes.background: The departure from the EU Customs Union means bilateral customs checks between ROI and UK, UK has promised unilaterally no physical border checks from its side between NI and ROI and NI and GB, this promise should be made into a legal guarantee as part of the so called "Great Repeal Bill".
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/uk-northern-ireland-border-brexit-eu-hard-no-deal-cabinet-irish-a8235096.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/irish-hard-border-soft-brexit-technology-theresa-may-a8242461.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-43277181

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/02/09/uk-must-set-stone-commitment-no-hard-irish-border-brexit-talks/

https://news.sky.com/story/government-wants-no-changes-to-irish-border-arrangements-10991079

attributes.action: Introduce a law for raised minimum temperature for employees or send home.
attributes.background: Worked as Receptionist & had poor work temperatures & inadequate heating for building. I feel it's important a law is put in place to outline a realistic,acceptable minimum & maximum work environment temperature for all employees or send employees home if needs are not met. As 16C is too cold.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The workplace (Health, Safety & Welfare) regulations 1992. 

There is "no law outlining the  minimum or maximum work environment temperature. According to Health & Safety executive a "reasonable" work environment should be provided by employers. According to the approved code of practice, a workplace should be atleast 16C and 13C for an environment that requires rigorous physical effort." I feel this is too cold for most in a work environment. This should be assessed and changed.

attributes.action: Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
attributes.background:
We have many paedophile hunting groups trying to tackle this problem 
Protecting our children should be priority number one
attributes.additional_details:
Currently over 100 hunting groups in the UK because the Police don't have the resources
Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
We have Parents taking to the streets in a bid to expose online predators because our current system does not scratch the surface

attributes.action: Make driving lessons and tests government funded and free for candidates.
attributes.background: Driving has become an increasingly vital part of everyday life, and yet learning to drive is ridiculously expensive with lessons costing upwards of £20 per hour and the practical test costing £62 a time, prices that are not feasible for the vast majority of UK citizens.

attributes.action: Stop Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Bus time on bank holiday is same Sunday. Many local councils make money using bus lane on bank holiday. Their actions is not benefit to our society.

attributes.action: Make it law that pubs and restaurants have to have diet lemonade available
attributes.background: If you want lemonade in a pub or restaurant then there is a good chance you have to have full sugar content lemonade. For those of us who are watching our waist line or have diabetes this is a real problem.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much pressure now for us all to reduce our sugar intake and pubs and restaurants should aid us in doing this. Also for those of us who are the designated driver and do not like coke/pepsi, this really restricts the drinks available to us.

attributes.action: More funding for a cure for patients suffering with IBD
attributes.background: The two main forms of inflammatory bowel disease are Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis. Both are chronic diseases that cause inflammation of the digestive system. As well as these intestinal problems, the disease may be associated with abnormalities of the joints, eyes, liver and skin.
attributes.additional_details: Crohn’s disease is the inflammation of the digestive system which leads to diarrhoea, abdominal pain, tiredness and weight loss. Ulcerative colitis is a lifelong disease that is associated with significant morbidity. With Ulcerative Colitis being the most common of the two most patients are diagnosed under the age of 25. Having the start of our lives filled with doctors appointments, hospital apppointments, to be used on clinical trials for drugs that can only surpress and not cure our illness.

attributes.action: Make sending sexual photo/film with or WITHOUT intent to cause distress illegal
attributes.background:
Section 33 of Criminal Justice and Court Act 2015
1)It is an offence for a person to disclose a private sexual photograph or film if the disclosure is made
(a)without the consent of an individual who appears in the photograph or film, and
(b)with the intention of causing that individual distress.
attributes.additional_details:
In section (8) the law says: "A person charged with an offence under this section is not to be taken to have disclosed a photograph or film with the intention of causing distress merely because that was a natural and probable consequence of the disclosure"

This law creates a loophole for criminals who did not consider their victim's reaction or the probable consequences of disclosure. The law needs to be reworded to 'with or without intent to cause distress' as the victim suffers despite intent

attributes.action: Make the Care Certificate a mandatory minimum qualification for all care staff
attributes.background:
The Care Certificate course, an outcome of the Cavendish review back in 2013, has still not been made mandatory training for care workers.

In fact, there is still no mandatory minimum level of training for care workers and no quality assurance for training in the care industry.
attributes.additional_details:
In the childcare industry, a nursery must ensure 50% of their workforce are trained to a minimum of Level 2 NVQ for the protection of the children in their care. Aside from DBS checks, many carers are providing care to elderly people in their homes where they live alone, and are doing so without a minimum level of skill.

As we face the realities of an aging population in the UK, what price do we put on providing the best possible care for our elderly relatives, friends, and relatives?

attributes.action: Make it illegal to burn state flags of all countries.
attributes.background: As we all know the UK is a very diverse and multicultural place especially London. For this reason, many people from different ethnics are united by flags that represent them. We must make it illegal to burn flags to decrease growing hate of different ethnics towards each other. eg Turks vs Kurds.

attributes.action: Make MPs provide an annual report to constituents on the work they've done
attributes.background: We are often told by politicians of their intentions at the time they wish for a vote, but accountability is often lost between elections. I ask that all politicians be required to provide a full, non election based report to all constituents on the progress they make on their pledges and beyond.

attributes.action: Require all schools to teach children about the severity of acid attacks.
attributes.background: We have recently seen increasing numbers in the amount of these life-changing acid attacks. For example, in 2012 the attack of Naomi Oni, who had acid chucked on her whilst walking through London. Since, 2012 acid attacks have doubled. It is vital that we educate children about this danger.
attributes.additional_details: Last year there were more than 450 acid attacks in London alone. Many have argued to make the sale of acids more regulated and that you should no longer to be able to 'buy it over the counter' however I do not think this is how we should tackle this problem. By further regulating the sale of acids we will not stop the problem directly, however by educating our youth on the effects of these life-changing attacks, we will hopefully see a decrease in the number of attacks in areas such as London.

attributes.action: Enforce the same rules for reclaimed stone as scrap metal, reducing theft.
attributes.background: There is a significant increase in the theft of stone, particularly wall copings (tops) and flags. These are taken and sold to reclaimed yards.  Law should be introduced the same as for scrap metal, ensuring people selling to identify themselves and payments are made to bank accounts only. No Cash

attributes.action: Academic research funded by the taxpayer should be free to read
attributes.background: The Government funds the majority of the UK’s academic research with taxpayer money. The results of this research, academic papers, are not accessible to the public because publishers charge £40 to read an article that is given to them for free. The public should not have to pay twice for research.
attributes.additional_details: You wouldn't be charged to enter an NHS hospital, why should you be charged to enter science? The British public is paying for 66% of university research (see: http://goo.gl/dnhLfw), but only 37% of it is free to read (http://goo.gl/4asiU8). Researchers give profitable publishers like Elsevier their work for free and can be charged as much as $5000 to hand over their own work (http://goo.gl/7in7LR). The policy fix: "Publicly funded research must be publicly available". More: http://goo.gl/sk1Hfa

attributes.action: Make UK taxpayers' salary and tax searchable and revealable to other taxpayers
attributes.background: Making taxpayers' salary revealable to other taxpayers is achievable with our digital tax system. Openness about salary and tax paid can act to reduce the gap between boardroom and shop-floor pay, gender pay gap and tax evasion.
attributes.additional_details: Any taxpayers whose salary is searched for and revealed will be able to see the name and ref number of the taxpayer who their salary and tax totals have been revealed to. This reduces spurious usage and makes it equitable in that the searcher's salary can be searched for too. Inequality thrives in dark corners, make salary and taxation more open in the UK!

attributes.action: Implement Nutrition Education In the School System
attributes.background: Nutrition is part of everyone's mind everyday and most having no knowledge of what a nutritionally balanced, delicious meal consists of is absurd. Type 2 Diabetes, Coronary Heart Disease, and Obesity are on the rise. People depend on pills for the rest of their lives when a healthy diet is the cure.
attributes.additional_details: A plant-based diet according to research has been shown to reverse the diseases above. NHS money, time, and resources are being wasted as people believe drugs and pills are the way to health.  People resort to taking weight loss pills, statins (cholesterol-lowering drugs), and blood pressure-reducing pills yet have a heavily processed meal several times a day as they have no way out due to education. The NHS spends £14 billion pounds for type 2 diabetes alone! Think of where that money could go!

attributes.action: Lower the drinking age to 16.
attributes.background: 16 is the legal age of consent and if you are thought resonsible enough to have a sexual relationship why aren't you thought responsible enough to drink safely?
attributes.additional_details: At the age of 16 you have finished high school and are staring sixthform or starting an apprenticeship. At this age you are responsible enough to handle money and know right from wrong.

attributes.action: Have Friday , Saturday and Sunday as a day of for all school children.
attributes.background: Going to school can be a mentally and physically demanding process and I believe children need an extra day off every week.
attributes.additional_details: I always have always  struggled mentally and physically demanding going to school five days a week.

attributes.action: All new build homes built in the last 5 years to be granted freehold interest.
attributes.background: Adverse publicity of developers including unreasonable clauses within leases on new houses has led to government consultation.  Developers should not hold power over new home buyers upon legal completion of the house.  People who buy a new build house want to be freeholders not tenants!

attributes.action: Require verified ID for anyone wishing to incorporate a Limited Company.
attributes.background: My business has recently been affected by fraud and the fraudster in question has previously been convicted of and imprisoned for such offences. By using a false name, anyone can easily escape their responsibilities and continue to incorporate new companies to continue to defrauding the public.
attributes.additional_details: By using a false name, fraudsters can easily escape their responsibilities and continue to incorporate new companies to continue to defrauding the public. By introducing ID checks on new company directors, fraud levels could be reduced.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time children have to spend at school
attributes.background: We need to reduce the amount of time children spend at school, this is due to the negative effects that can be caused to children if they spend extended periods of time at school like depression. I ask that the UK Government reduce the amount of time a child in the UK has to spend at school.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public transport (buses) to be fitted with seatbelts.
attributes.background: In light of the two elderly ladies who were recently injured on a public transport bus.

attributes.action: Incentivise NHS staff retention by writing off student debt for employees.
attributes.background: NHS staff retention is at an all time low in the current economic climate. A large portion of freshly graduated students are looking for jobs oversees due to a lack of incentive to remain in the NHS and the country. To combat this, we propose eliminating student debt for long term NHS employees.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is for a point based system based on time served. This would mean people would give greater consideration to stay with the NHS for a longer period of time. In return, they would be given a larger reduction in debt in accordance with their time spent in the public services.
In the event of leaving the service, the remaining balance would then be calculated by deducting the  value of time served.  A proposal of 10 -15 years service would see all debt removed.

attributes.action: Retest EVERY driver every 10 years when photo card licence needs to be renewed.
attributes.background:
Currently, driving licences last until the holder reaches 70 years, but the photograph on their licence must be updated every 10 years. 
As an Approved Driving Instructor (ADI) I have to be re-tested every so-often to prove that I am "up to standard". Why not apply the same rule to all drivers?
attributes.additional_details: Driving licence photos must be renewed every 10 years. MANY drivers say "I couldn't pass my test again". We (ADI's) are required to teach "safe driving for life". Rules change. Signs change. Road layouts change. Change the licence requirements. DVSA could call the renewing licence holder for a "check" free of charge. If the licence holder passes their check DVLA will issue a renewed licence. If the holder fails the check their licence would be suspended until they pay for each check and pass.

attributes.action: Introduce a Minister for Older People in England, as they have in Wales.
attributes.background:
This role needs to be established because currently nobody is taking overall responsibility for ensuring society treats older citizens fairly.
Pensioners in England, to whom we owe a huge debt of gratitude, should be treated with the dignity, care and respect.
attributes.additional_details: For far too long, an undercurrent of inter-generational strife has been building, with the elderly being targeted to take money from in order to help younger generations. However most young people would not wish to see pensioners deprived of their rights, or left in poverty. We need someone to liaise across Government departments, such as Treasury and Health, to ensure fairness for the wellbeing of older generations.

attributes.action: Refund 50% of 2018 car tax to offset the cost to Motorists and Motorbike Riders
attributes.background:
Due to the Extreme weather conditions 
The UK Roads are at their worst condition for years and are filled with potholes and loose chipping that are causing untold damage to suspension and tyres. This heavy cost of repair is a burden. Councils have not carried out repairs so a refund should assist

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act for any British politician to lie or deceive UK citizens
attributes.background: Politicians seem to be able to say what they want without being held to account, if there was some kind of criminal action that can be taken to insure a little bit more truth in their actions and words. Perhaps this force them to be honest with the British public.

attributes.action: lift the flight ban to sharm el sheikh
attributes.background: we have had wonderful holidays in sharm el sheikh,  It is time for this ridiculous ban to be ended and to help the egyptians in sharm to get back on their feet. It seems all other countries are now able to fly direct to sharm except the uk, please lift the ban.

attributes.action: Require all businesses who sell food to provide dairy alternatives
attributes.background: A growing number of children are being daignosed with dairy intolerance. Wouldn't it be nice to stop at your local ice cream parlour and be able to buy a dairy alternative ice cream or take your diary intolerant child out for a milkshake at any cafe without having to check with them first?
attributes.additional_details: Seems such a small thing but trying to explain to a little boy he can't have an ice cream on the seafront but the other children can is heart breaking. I believe it's about time businesses were forced to supply an alternative to dairy to meet the growing needs of intolerant children and adults.

attributes.action: Give equal survivor pension benefits to widows and widowers of female teachers.
attributes.background: Men and women have always paid equal contributions into the teachers' pension scheme. However, widowers of women teachers continue to receive lower amounts than widows of men teachers. The DfE recently announced that spouses / civil partners of same-sex couples will receive equal benefits to widows.
attributes.additional_details:
The bereaved spouses of teachers receive different levels of pension benefits, depending on gender and sexual orientation. Men married to women are disadvantaged compared to those in all other legal relationships. Survivors receive 50% of their partner's pension accrued since 1972. However, only contributions since 1988 count towards survivor benefits for the husbands of female teachers. 
See: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/occupational-pension-schemes-review-of-survivor-benefits

attributes.action: Attach a mandatory Prison term to every charged Drink Driving case
attributes.background: Charged Drink Driving offences rarely carry any prison sentence and those with the money can easily afford any fine or ban. Adding a mandatory jail sentence should again make people think twice regardless of their status.
attributes.additional_details: Celebrities getting off with just fines and bans.

attributes.action: Create a Strategic Marine Resources Act
attributes.background:
Promote the protection of marine resources in the UK/British EEZ's
Safe guard UK fisheries within UK/British EEZ's post Brexit
Create and protect a sustainable asset for the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Under the UNCLOS each country has an EEZ and the protection of this natural resource is an important part of the members commitment.

The UK has no Strategic Fisheries Resources Act, and it does not have a Strategic Maritime Resources Act.

attributes.action: Refuse to take part in war in Syria and find a diplomatic path to peace
attributes.background: Bombing Syria will not help the situation. It will kill more civilians and ignite a conflict that could spiral out of control, causing massive devastation. We call on the government to refuse to engage in the conflict. Focus on political solutions and aiding diplomacy between the US and Russia
attributes.additional_details: A conflict in Syria between U.S. and Russian forces is not only something that we cannot afford to take part in, it's something we should do everything in our power to prevent. The potential consequences of such a conflict - a huge civilian death toll and the risk of igniting nuclear war - are things that need to be avoided at all costs. We urge the government not to take part in any military action in Syria but instead, with urgency, focus all available resources on finding political solutions and aiding diplomatic relations between the U.S. and Russian governments.

attributes.action: Change the law to ensure that NICE guidance outweighs the "Bolam Test"
attributes.background: I have suffered a heart attack which left me disabled. I allege this was due to sub-standard practices. However, solicitors say that my case would not meet the 'Bolam Test', in that, if a similar expert would have 'done the same thing' then a claim will fail even if NICE guidance has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Nice Guidance states that “If you currently have chest pain ... you may need to go to hospital as an emergency ... if you do not currently have chest pain and your ECG was normal … you should have an assessment in hospital on the same day" 
(Solicitor's response - below) 
".. NICE guidelines are recommendations ... advice they provide should not be compared to .. many years of professional experience".

attributes.action: Repair pot holed roads by introduction of vignette system for foreign drivers
attributes.background: Many countries in Europe make road users pay to use motorways and major roads, either by way of tolls or a vignette system. I propose introducing a Vignette system in the UK for foreign drivers which would raise revenue to be shared amongst the counties and used solely for repairing road surfaces.
attributes.additional_details: Pot holes in UK roads are increasing due to councils lack of funds for repairs. This causes serious safety issues for drivers and cyclists and can cause major damage to vehicles.

attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Start charging for non-emergencies in A & E across the U.K
attributes.background:
There are too many people wasting Doctors time & resources in 
A & E Departments across the U.K. I think these non-emergencies should be charged for time wasting when these people could have gone to their GP or pharmacist to get sorted. The monies collected should then be put back into the system.

attributes.action: To debate the impact of not returning FULL control of our fisheries to the UK.
attributes.background: The decision to continue to allow EU fishing vessels access to UK  waters crosses political boundaries as the current EU policy is damaging our fish stocks and our fishing industry. It needs to be a Brexit negotiation red line as a plastic free ocean without fish is failure
